block.p: Kimberly Ann Hamm, a lawyer, and Alexander Elias Rendon, a writer, were married Friday morning at the New York City Municipal Building.

The bride, 35, will keep her name. She is an associate at the London office of Simpson Thacher & Bartlett, the New York law firm. She graduated from the University of Florida and received a law degree from New York University.
Kimberly Ann Hamm, a lawyer, and Alexander Elias Rendon, a writer, were married Friday morning at the New York City Municipal Building.

The bride, 35, will keep her name. She is an associate at the London office of Simpson Thacher & Bartlett, the New York law firm. She graduated from the University of Florida and received a law degree from New York University.

She is the daughter of Jerrine F. and Ernest D. Hamm of Jacksonville, Fla. Her father retired as the crime laboratory analyst supervisor for the Florida Department of Law Enforcement in Jacksonville, where her mother retired as a communications assistant for the Army Corps of Engineers.

The bridegroom, 38, is a freelance writer in London and was until last September a staff writer for SmartMoney magazine in New York. He graduated from Ithaca College and received a master's degree in journalism from the University of California, Berkeley.

He is the son of R. Joyce and Michael Rendon of Magalia, Calif. His mother, who is retired, sold real estate for Century 21 Gross & Jansen in Vernon, N.J. His father, also retired, was the parts manger for Trend Motors, a Volkswagen dealership in Rockaway, N.J.
